subject: Re: It's still toooo much work!
author: mrscaptainjack2
full_text:
I've just had a thought (maybe the only one today!):  would it be possible to tell one of my guys -- Steve perhaps if he comes back around -- to go visit Frank and talk to him (telling him something besides gloom and doom)?  Has that ever happened before, where an entity is heard on two different people's boxes, and the people operating those boxes don't know each other?  



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>
>  Assembly time is cut in half with the printed circuits boards, but it's
> still tedious. All resistors and non-electrolytic caps are surface mount.
> The wood box I picked up at the thrift store this afternoon for $1--had a
> feeling I should go check to see what they had. The previous TRF boards took
> 36 hours, just for the board, this one took 16. Then maybe an hour all
> togeter for the antenna, it has to be wound, then glued, then the turns
> adjusted for full band coverage.
> 
>  At 10 seconds on --2 "giant Earth quake" and I heard that before I started
> recording as I was adjusting the tuning voltage.
> 
>  Yeah, I know--I have all the fun---yea!
> 
> Framl-S
>
